tuv.seg: Notification requirements for marriage
Riachtanais fógartha don phósadh

Since the commencement of Part 6 of the Civil Registration Act 2004 in November 2007, anyone notifying a Registrar of their intention to get married in Ireland must give 3 months' notification in person to the Registrar

Ó tháinig Cuid 6 den Acht um Chlárú Sibhialta, 2004 i bhfeidhm i Samhain 2007, ní mór d’aon duine atá tabhairt fógra do Chláraitheoir go bhfuil sé i gceist acu pósadh in Éirinn, fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt go pearsanta don Chláraitheoir

This applies to all marriages, whether solemnised by a Registrar or according to religious or secular rites and ceremonies, unless you intend marrying your civil partner and your civil partnership was registered in Ireland

Baineann seo le gach pósadh, bíodh siad sollúnta ag Cláraitheoir nó de réir deasghnátha agus searmanais saolta nó reiligiúnacha, mura mbeartaíonn tú do pháirtnéir sibhialta a phósadh agus má bhí do phósadh sibhialta cláraithe in Éirinn
The Registrar does not have to be the Registrar for the district where you live or where you intend getting married
Ní chaithfidh an Cláraitheoir a bheith ina Chláraitheoir don cheantar ina bhfuil cónaí oraibh ná don cheantar ina mbeartaíonn sibh pósadh
You need to make an appointment with the Registrar in order to give the notification
Is gá duit coinne a dhéanamh leis an gCláraitheoir d’fhonn an fógra a thabhairt
In order to ensure the notification is given at least 3 months before the date you intend getting married on, it is advisable to arrange the appointment well in advance
Lena chinntiú go dtugtar an fógra ar a laghad 3 mhí roimh an dáta a bheartaíonn tú pósadh, moltar duit an choinne a shocrú i bhfad roimh ré
A couple in a civil partnership who wish to marry should contact the Registrar who will guide them through the process
Ba cheart do lánúin i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta ar mian leo pósadh teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an gCláraitheoir a threoróidh iad tríd an bpróiseas
If you plan to get married by civil ceremony and a different Registrar will be solemnising the marriage, you must also contact the Registrar's Office for the district you intend getting married in

Má tá sé beartaithe agat pósadh trí shearmanas sibhialta agus má bheidh an pósadh á shollúnú ag Cláraitheoir éagsúil, ní mór duit teagmháil a dhéanamh le hOifig an Chláraitheora don cheantar ina mbeartaíonn tú pósadh
A couple getting married are required to give notification in person of their intention to marry to a Registrar at least 3 months before the intended date of the marriage
Ní foláir do lánúin atá ag pósadh fógra pearsanta a thabhairt faoina rún chun pósta chuig Cláraitheoir ar a laghad 3 mhí roimh dháta ceaptha a bpósta
The requirement to give a 3-month notice does not apply to civil partners whose civil partnership was registered in Ireland – see 'Civil partners' below
Ní bhíonn feidhm leis an riachtanas chun fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt do pháirtithe sibhialta a cláraíodh an pháirtnéireacht shibhialta in Éirinn – féach 'Páirtithe sibhialta' thíos
The notification can be given to any Registrar
Is féidir fógra a thabhairt chuig Cláraitheoir ar bith
When you make the appointment with the Registrar you will be informed what information and documents you need to bring with you
Nuair a cheapann tú coinne leis an gCláraitheoir is amhlaidh a chuirfear ar an eolas tú cad iad an fhaisnéis agus na cáipéisí a chaithfidh tú a thabhairt leat
As well as bringing original or certified copies of the documents, you also need to bring photocopies of the documents
Chomh maith le bunchóipeanna nó cóipeanna deimhnithe de na cáipéisí a thabhairt leat, caithfidh tú fótachóipeanna de na cáipéisí úd a thabhairt leat freisin
In the case of a passport, a good quality, colour photocopy or a passport-sized photo is required
I gcás pas éigin, teastaíonn fótachóip den scoth, ildaite nó grianghraf de mhéid pas
If a document is not written in English or Irish, a certified English translation from an independent, verifiable, translation company must be provided
Caithfear aistriúchán Béarla deimhnithe a sholáthar ó chomhlacht aistriúcháin neamhspleách, infhíoraithe mura bhfuil cáipéis éigin scríofa sa Bhéarla ná sa Ghaeilge
Generally, you and your intended spouse will each be required to bring the following:
Beidh ort agus ar do chéile ceaptha go hiondúil an méid seo a leanas a thabhairt leo:

• Birth Certificate – if not issued by the Civil Registration Service in Ireland it must bear an apostille stamp from the relevant embassy (if possible) or a letter from that embassy attesting the authenticity of the certificate should be supplied

• Teastas Breithe – murab í an tSeirbhís Chlárúcháin Shibhialta in Éirinn a eisíonn é, caithfidh stampa apastaile bheith air ón ambasáid ábhartha (más féidir) nó ba cheart litir a sholáthar ón ambasáid sin mar fhianaise do bharántúlacht an teastais
This does not apply to birth certificates issued by Denmark, Italy, France, Belgium or Latvia
Ní bhíonn feidhm leis sin do theastais bhreithe arna n-eisiúint ag an Danmhairg, an Iodáil, an Fhrainc, an Bheilg ná an Laitvia
• Original final divorce decrees in respect of all previous divorces if divorced – if it was a foreign divorce contact the Registrar for instruction
• Bun-fhoraithní colscartha deiridh i ndáil le gach colscaradh roimhe sin más duine colscartha tú – déan teagmháil leis an gCláraitheoir i gcomhair treoracha dá mba cholscaradh eachtrach a bhí ann
• Original dissolution decrees in respect of all previous civil partnerships if you have a civil partnership dissolution
• Bun-fhoraithní scaoilte i ndáil le gach páirtnéireacht shibhialta roimhe seo má tá scaoileadh páirtnéireachta sibhialta agat
• Final decree of nullity and a letter from the relevant court confirming that no appeal was lodged, if you were in a civil partnership or marriage that was annulled by an Irish court

• Foraithne neamhnithe deiridh agus litir ón gcúirt ábhartha lena ndeimhnítear nár taisceadh achomharc ar bith, má bhí tú i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta nó i bpósadh ar chuir cúirt Éireannach ar neamhní iad
• Deceased spouse's death certificate and previous civil marriage certificate if either of you is widowed
• Teastas báis chéile éagtha agus teastas pósta shibhialta roimhe sin má tá ceachtar agaibh in bhur mbaintreach (fir)
• Documentary evidence of immigration status if not a citizen of Ireland or an EU member state
• Fianaise fhaisnéiseach de stádas inimirce mura saoránach de chuid na hÉireann ná de bhallstát an AE atá ionat
• A Letter of Freedom to Marry or other documentary confirmation of civil status from county of origin if not a citizen of Ireland
• Litir Shaoirse chun Pósta nó deimhniú faisnéiseach eile de stádas sibhialta ón tír bhunaidh mura saoránach d’Éirinn tú
You will also have to provide information about the intended marriage such as:
Beidh ort freisin eolas a sholáthar i leith an phósta cheaptha ar nós:
• Whether it will be a civil, secular or religious ceremony
• An mbeidh sé ina shearmanas sibhialta, dí-eaglasta nó reiligiúnach
• The intended date and location of the marriage
• Dáta agus suíomh ceaptha an phósta
• Details of the proposed solemniser of the marriage
• Mionsonraí shollúnóir molta an phósta
• The names and dates of birth of the 2 proposed witnesses
• Ainmneacha agus dátaí breithe na beirte finnéithe molta
• A PPS number is required for all parties serving notice of intention to marry, who have a current or a future address within the State
• Teastaíonn uimhir PSP i gcomhair gach páirtí a sheirbheálann fógra de rún chun pósta, ag a mbíonn seoladh reatha nó amach anseo sa Stát acu
You should download and complete the Data Capture Form (pdf), and bring it with you
Ba cheart duit an Fhoirm Ghabhála Sonraí (pdf) a íoslódáil agus a chomhlánú, agus í a thabhairt leat
You will also have to pay a notification fee
Caithfidh tú táille fhógraithe a íoc freisin
If you, your intended spouse, the witnesses or the solemniser has a limited knowledge of English, the services of an interpreter is required
Teastaíonn seirbhísí ateangaire má tá cur amach teoranta agatsa, ag do chéilese ceaptha, ag an bhfinné ná ag an sollúnóir ar an mBéarla
The interpreter must be from an independent, verifiable translation company and be present for both the notification and the marriage
Caitheann an t-ateangaire teacht ó chomhlacht aistriúcháin neamhspleách infhíoraithe agus bheith i láthair don fhógra agus don phósadh araon
When you meet the Registrar you will be required to sign, in the Registrar's presence, a declaration that you know of no lawful impediment to your proposed marriage
Beidh ort dearbhú a shíniú i bhfianaise an Chláraitheora nuair a bhuailfidh tú leis an gCláraitheoir féin, nach eol duit aon chol dlíthiúil do do phósadh molta
The Registrar will issue an acknowlegement to both of you and the proposed solemniser of the marriage confirming the date of receipt of notification
Eiseoidh an Cláraitheoir aitheantas daoibh beirt agus do shollúnóir molta an phósta ina ndeimhneofar dáta fála an fhógra
This does not give you permission to marry
Ní thugtar cead chun pósta daoibh leis sin

Under the Civil Registration Act 2004 (as amended by the Civil Registration (Amendment) Act 2014), the Registrar has the right to investigate and decide whether an intended marriage would be a marriage of convenience for immigration purposes

Tá an ceart ag an gCláraitheoir faoin Acht um Chlárú Sibhialta 2004 (arna leasú ag an Acht um Chlárú Sibhialta (Leasú) 2014), chun imscrúdú agus cinneadh a dhéanamh ar phósadh áisiúlachta chun cuspóirí inimirce é
If all the information required has been supplied and there is no impediment to the marriage, the Registrar will issue you with a Marriage Registration Form (see below)
Má soláthraíodh gach eolas riachtanach agus nach ann d’aon chol don phósadh, is amhlaidh a eiseoidh an Cláraitheoir Foirm Chlárúcháin Phósta duit (féach thíos)
You can find more information on notification requirements on the Health Service Executive (HSE) website
Is féidir leat níos mó eolais i leith na riachtanas fógraithe a fháil ar láithreán gréasáin Fheidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS)

If your civil partnership ceremony took place in the State and you now wish to marry your civil partner, you must, by appointment, attend the Registrar at least 5 days (or as determined by the Registrar) before the intended date of the ceremony to sign a declaration in their presence that there is no impediment to the marriage

Má thit searmanas bhur bpáirtnéireachta sibhialta amach sa Stát agus más mian leat do pháirtnéir sibhialta a phósadh, ní mór duit, trí choinne, cuairt a thabhairt ar an gCláraitheoir ar a laghad 5 lá (nó faoi mar a chinneann an Cláraitheoir) roimh dháta beartaithe an tsearmanais chun dearbhú a shíniú ina láthair nach bhfuil aon bhac ar an bpósadh
You pay a reduced fee
Íocann tú táille laghdaithe

If your civil partnership ceremony took place abroad you will be required to give the Registrar 3 months’ notice of your intention to marry and complete the standard preliminaries for a valid marriage

Má thit searmanas bhur bpáirtnéireachta sibhialta amach thar lear, beidh ort fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt don Chláraitheoir go bhfuil sé ar intinn agaibh pósadh agus na réamhriachtanais chaighdeánacha le haghaidh pósadh bailí a chomhlánú
If either of you are living abroad or are unable to attend a Registration Office due to serious illness, you should contact a Registrar to get permission to make your 3-month notification by post

Má tá ceachtar agaibh ag maireachtáil thar lear, nó mura bhfuil duine agaibh in ann freastal ar Oifig Chláraithe mar gheall ar dhroch-thinneas, ba chóir daoibh teagmháil a dhéanamh le Cláraitheoir chun cead a fháil an fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt sa phost
If permission is granted, the Registrar will send you a form which you must complete and return
Má thugtar cead daoibh, seolfaidh an Cláraitheoir foirm chugaibh nach mór daoibh a chomhlánú agus a sheoladh ar ais
You will still have to make arrangements to meet the Registrar at least 5 days before you get married in order to make the declaration
Beidh oraibh fós socruithe a dhéanamh chun bualadh leis an gCláraitheoir ar a laghad 5 lá roimh an bpósadh chun an dearbhú a thabhairt
This is required before a Marriage Registration Form can be issued
Teastaíonn sé seo sular féidir Foirm Chláraithe Pósta a eisiúint
In certain special circumstances, for example, in the case of very serious illness, you may be able to get a Court Exemption Order allowing the marriage to proceed without the 3-month notification

I gcúinsí speisialta ar leith, mar shampla, i gcás tinneas an-tromchúiseach, b'fhéidir go mbeadh ar bhur gcumas Ordú Díolúine Cúirte a fháil a thugann cead don phósadh dul chun cinn gan an fógra trí mhí
You should contact either the Circuit Family Court or the High Court in the area in which either of you lives for details on how to proceed
Ba chóir daoibh dul i dteagmháil leis an Cúirt Chuarda Teaghlaigh nó leis an Ard-Chúirt sa cheantar ina bhfuil cónaí ar dhuine agaibh chun sonraí a fháil maidir le conas dul ar aghaidh leis seo
This is an informal procedure
Is nós imeachta neamhfhoirmiúil é seo
You may apply in person (without hiring a solicitor)
Is féidir libh iarratas a sheoladh isteach (gan aturnae a fháil)
There is no court charge for an application for a Court Exemption Order
Níl aon táille cúirte i gceist ar iarratas ar Ordú Díolúine Cúirte
However, if you hire a solicitor to represent you, you will have to pay them
Má fhaigheann tú aturnae chun ionadaíocht a dhéanamh ort, beidh ort é/í a íoc
The court will require you to show:
Ní mór duit na nithe seo a leanas a léiriú don chúirt:
• That there are good reasons for your application
• Go bhfuil cúiseanna maithe le d'iarratas
• That the granting of such an Exemption Order is in the best interests of the parties to the intended marriage
• Go bhfuil deonú Ordú Díolúine den sórt seo ar son dea-leasa na bpáirtithe sa phósadh atá beartaithe
If you are granted a Court Exemption Order, you still have to make arrangements to meet the Registrar at least 5 days before you get married in order to make the declaration
Má thugtar Ordú Díolúine Cúirte duit, beidh oraibh fós socruithe a dhéanamh chun bualadh leis an gCláraitheoir ar a laghad 5 lá sula bpósann sibh chun an dearbhú a dhéanamh
This is required before a Marriage Registration Form can be issued
Teastaíonn sé seo sular féidir Foirm Chláraithe Pósta a eisiúint
A Marriage Registration Form (MRF) is like a marriage licence
Tá Foirm Chláraithe Pósta (FCP) cosúil le teastas pósta
It gives authorisation for a couple to marry and you require one in order to get married in Ireland
Tugann sé údarú do bheirt pósadh agus teastaíonn ceann acu uaibh chun pósadh in Éirinn
Providing there is no impediment to the marriage, the Registrar will issue you with an MRF
Chomh fada is nach bhfuil aon bhac ar an bpósadh, eiseoidh an Cláraitheoir FCP daoibh
If you bring all the documentation and information required to the meeting with the Registrar, the Registrar may be able to issue the MRF immediately
Má thugann sibh an cháipéisíocht agus an t-eolas riachtanach ar fad libh chuig an gcruinniú leis an gCláraitheoir, b'fhéidir go mbeadh an Cláraitheoir ábalta an FCP a eisiúint láithreach
If the marriage does not take place within 6 months of the date of marriage given on the MRF, a new MRF will be required if you still intend to marry
Mura dtarlaíonn an pósadh taobh istigh de 6 mhí ón dáta atá ar an FCP, beidh gá le FCP nua má tá sé fós i gceist agaibh pósadh
You will be required to repeat the notification process
Beidh oraibh dul tríd an bpróiseas fógartha arís
The standard notification fee is €200
Is é an táille caighdeánach € 200
There is a reduced notification fee of €50 for same-sex couples who are already in a civil partnership that is registered in Ireland and now wish to marry
Is ionann an táille laghdaithe le haghaidh páirtnéirí sibhialta ar cláraíodh a bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta in Éirinn agus €50
Three months' notification can be given to any Registrar but must be given in person
Is féidir fógra trí mhí a thabhairt do Chláraitheoir ar bith, ach ní mór é a thabhairt go pearsanta
Civil partners who do not have to give 3 month's notification must attend the Registrar at least 5 days (or as determined by the Registrar) before the intended date of the ceremony

Ní mór do pháirtnéirí sibhialta nach bhfuil orthu fógra 3 mhí a thabhairt cuairt a thabhairt ar an gCláraitheoir ar a laghad 5 lá (nó faoi mar a chinneann an Cláraitheoir) roimh dháta beartaithe an tsearmanais
You can find a list of Registrars offices here. You can book an appointment with a Registrar online at crsappointments.ie
Tá fáil ar liosta Cláraitheoirí ar láithreán gréasáin Oifig an Ard-Chláraitheora
Contact details for your local Registrar are also available from your Local Health Office in the HSE
Is féidir leat leabhar coinne a dhéanamh le Cláraitheoir ar líne ag crsappointments.ie
